snippet: After years of trying to repeal the health care law, Republicans believe they are getting traction thanks to what they see as a self-inflicted wound by the Obama administration.
abstract: House Republican leaders seize on Obama administration's one-year delay of mandate for larger employers to offer health insurance or face penalties, demanding the same postponement for the mandate on individual insurance purchases and promising a series of showdowns aimed at dividing Democrats from the White House.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: After years of trying to repeal the health care law, Republicans believe they are getting traction thanks to what they see as a self-inflicted wound by the Obama administration.

headline.main: Seeing Opening, House G.O.P. Pushes Delay on Individual Mandate in Health Law
headline.print_headline: Seeing Opening, House G.O.P. Pushes Delay on Individual Mandate in Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
